entities.trees

Class TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.trees.TDP_Problem_Instance
      • entities.trees.TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance

  • public class TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance
extends TDP_Problem_Instance
    A class for Î¤-DP problems that are equi-join star queries with *binary relations*: A star query of size l involves one parent relation R1 and l-1 other relations hanging off of it. All the children relation of R1 join with A1 which is the first attribute of R1. Particularly useful for identifying star patterns in graphs. The goal of T-DP is to find the minimum total weight of a query result. Inside this class it is safe to downcast TDP_State_Node.state_info to Tuple (except the starting_state).
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

    • Constructor Detail

      • TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance

        public TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance(Star_Equijoin_Query query)
        For each tuple, we create a T-DP state. Every relation maps to a stage of T-DP. The starting node is artificial and the terminal nodes are implicit (To avoid the unnecessary overhead, we omit the terminal nodes). The cost of transitioning to a tuple is the cost of that tuple.

    • Method Detail

      • bottom_up

        public void bottom_up()
        Description copied from class: TDP_Problem_Instance
        The bottom-up phase of T-DP creates a T-DP state/node for each tuple. Every relation maps to a stage of T-DP. The starting node is artificial and the terminal nodes are implicit (To avoid the unnecessary overhead, we omit the terminal nodes). The cost of transitioning to a tuple is the cost of that tuple. After the bottom-up phase, the optimal cost is the minimum achievable cost from starting_node. The optimal (top-1) solution can be reconstructed by going top-down and following best decisions.
        Specified by:
        bottom_up in class TDP_Problem_Instance

      • hash_stage

        private HashMap<Double,List<TDP_State_Node>> hash_stage(List<TDP_State_Node> stage,
                                                        int join_attribute)
        Hashes the nodes of a particular stage of T-DP. The key is one of the attributes of the associated tuples that will be used for the join.
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage to be hashed.
        join_attribute - The index of the attribute that will be used as the key.
        Returns:
        HashMap>

        public static void main(String[] args)
